page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY}The enclosure of Leverton was completed in 1795 after many arguments. The parishes of Leverton and Habblesthorpe being inter-mixed and division made more difficult by church lands. The infield system of fields was also associated with 28 named strips which were in great demand. There has never been a Lord of the Manor in the accepted sense. The modern field system resembles the original open fields of 800 years ago. In the original Domesday book North Legreton was a part of the Soke of Laneham given by the king to the Arch Bishop of York. Church dates from 1180 Habblethorpe church is now a ruin. Windmill was built in 1813 - and rebuiult in 1919? was used for milling corn until the introducion of engines and eletric motors.
